description: Korosho is more than just a cashew company – we are a movement, dedicated to reshaping the global cashew industry while making a positive impact on the lives of farmers, communities, and consumers alike.   We pride ourselves on sourcing the finest cashews from Tanzania. Nestled in the Makonde Plateau, a region in southern Tanzania the tropical climate provides the perfect conditions for cashew cultivation. With temperatures ranging between 15 and 33 degrees Celsius year-round and an average annual rainfall of 1000mm, our cashews thrive without the need for additional irrigation, resulting in exceptionally large and delicious nuts.  The region is situated along the Indian Ocean just south of the equator and boasts natural wonders like Mount Kilimanjaro, Lake Victoria, and the renowned Serengeti National Park. Our company name, "Korosho," derived from the Swahili word for cashew, pays homage to the rich cultural and linguistic tapestry of Tanzania.   Despite being the sixth-largest cashew-producing country globally, much of Tanzania's harvest is exported raw to Asia for processing, depriving the local economy of valuable opportunities and contributing unnecessary CO2 emissions. By leveraging local expertise and infrastructure, we streamline the supply chain, enabling us to transport our cashews directly to Europe without detours through Southeast Asia. This direct sea route reduces transportation time and carbon emissions, allowing us to deliver fresher products to our customers. On top of that, we arw committed to preserving and promoting the small-scale farming traditions of the Makonde region. For over a century, cashews have been a vital source of sustenance for local families, with each household typically owning at least one cashew tree. Rather than sourcing from large plantations, we directly engage with numerous farming families to procure our cashew harvest. Our approach emphasizes direct relationships with small-scale farmers, bypassing middlemen to ensure fair compensation for their labor. From harvesting to sorting, drying, and quality control, our cashews undergo meticulous processing overseen by local partners and women's organizations. Similarly, packaging, storage, and transportation are entrusted to local entrepreneurs, minimizing our environmental footprint and supporting local economies. As champions of constant innovation, we are committed to offering not only new and exciting snack varieties but also innovative vegan options. To minimize our ecological impact, all our products are processed and packaged in Germany, further reducing transportation distances and emissions. Our commitment to sustainability extends to our packaging, featuring the first 100% plastic-free paper packaging in the snack industry in Germany. After enjoying our delicious cashews, customers can simply dispose of the packaging in the recycling bin, where it can be fully recycled.
name: Korosho

pitchCaptions.text:
Hello, I'm Christoph from Korosho,
the Cashewnut Company.
And we are all about cashews.
But why cashews?

Because cashews are a very healthy
source of proteins, vitamins, magnesium
and many other good things.

And we buy our cashews directly
from farmers in Tanzania,
pay them fairly and bring them here.

So we make sure that they get
a fair share and you get the best taste.
Our cashews are special.

Firstly, because we bring them directly
without detour to Germany,  which

is why they are, fresher and richer
in taste than any other cashews.
Secondly, because they are huge.

They grow perfectly without any further
water use or fertilisation.

And thirdly, because we have
truly sustainable packaging.

The first 100% paper-based
packaging in Germany.

Did you know that most cashews  in
the world are grown in Africa, but then,

with a lot of emissions, are sent
across the world to India or Vietnam

and are then processed under bad
working conditions and unfair salaries?
And we want to stop that.

With our brother company in Tanzania
and our direct and fair supply chain
from Tanzania to Germany.

Behind Korocho are us, the three founders
Christoph, Oliver and Alex,

and our Brother company in Tanzania,
which would also like to say hello.
Hello!

I am Bosco Namagaya, Director
of Tanzania Delicious Cashews Ltd.
We are a local company of eight farmers.

We are very happy to be working with
Korosho GmbH, who helped us a lot
to bring our cashews to you in Germany.

shortDescription: More than just a cashew nut company

description: j'ai mal à la tête was founded in 2012 by Anja Pawlik and Roman Dorfner in Munich, Germany. With a phrase from his work „ e book of disquiet“ the Portuguese writer Fernando Pessoa provides the inspiration for the name of the men ́s label. “J´ai mal à la tête et à l´univers“ – Too much is crackling in, while nothing entangles. The focus on what stays seems to be more important than ever. Thus, Anja Pawlik and Roman Dorfner create autonomous fashion beyond medial imperatives or trendy randomness. In their collections they play with stereotypical male images, without neglecting the high standards men demand from their clothing. A sporty but yet elegant silhouette meets the need of postmodern individualists to dress masculinely and originally at the same time. The ideal of “J´ai mal à la tête”: To transform the swift zeitgeist into timeless pieces. This sustainability in creation lives on the sustainability in production.
descriptionTitle: Fashion against headaches and world fatigue?
name: j‘ai mal à la tête

pitchCaptions.text:
'J'ai mal à la tête et à l'univers'. A
sentence from the work 'The book

of unrest' by Fernando Pessoa gave
us the inspiration for the name of our
fashion label J'ai mal à la tête.

We have our entire collection
manufactured almost exclusively

in Germany and maintain a very close
dialogue with our productions.

A key aspect of our work is,
that we work with so-called deadstocks.
In other words, these are fabrics of

mostly high-end brands
that already exist and have not
been specially developed for us,

which makes our product
even more sustainable.

We produce in small quantities and
take care not to generate any overstock.

So not only do you get very exclusive
parts from us, but you also

benefit from your contribution
to preventing fast fashion waste.

For around five years, we have only
been selling directly to the end consumer
in our store in Munich
and our webshop.

Take a look and let
J'ai mal à la tête convince you.

Founded in Munich in 2012,
together with my partner Anja,

with the idea, to help quality and
fashion-conscious men, but also women.

Our aim is to combine
zeitgeist and functionality
with your need to dress

in an original
and individual way.

We attach great importance
to comfort & durability
and guarantee you
high quality and fair production
for each of our parts.

pitchSections.title: What the heck is j‘ai mal à la tête?
pitchSections.subtitle: Roman, Co-Founder

description:
Our Story

Meet Max, Carlos, and Raoul, the founders of JUMA. During our college years, we realized that neither coffee nor energy drinks were the right choice for us to stay energized throughout the day. That's why we set out on a quest for a better alternative – and found it in Ecuador.

A Fresh Alternative

JUMA BETTER ENERGY FOR YOU is the result of our search for a healthy and invigorating option for your daily energy boost. Based on Guayusa, our products are not only delicious but also provide the same wake-up effect as coffee while being as gentle as tea.

Direct Trade for Sustainability

Our organic Guayusa comes directly from a self-managed farmer cooperative in Tenar, Ecuador. Through direct trade, we not only support the local community but also preserve biodiversity through sustainable cultivation in permaculture farms.

1% for the Planet

As a member of 1% for the Planet, we donate 1% of our annual revenue to environmental and biodiversity projects, primarily in the region where we source our Guayusa. Your purchase at JUMA directly supports the protection and restoration of our environment.
name: Juma

pitchCaptions.text:
Hot or cold,
Juma means Better Energy for You.
And how do we do that?

We use the most caffeinated tea
in the world in our products.

The great thing about this tea is that it
wakes you up without making you nervous.
Just try it out.

Our products are special because of
their content, because Guayusa is inside.

Guayusa is not only the most caffeinated
leaf in the world, but also has

a special set of effects that means
you don't get shaky nor palpitations
and it is also very good for the stomach.

This means for all those who need a bit
of energy for sport, concentration

at work or simply need a little more
well-being, is Guayusa and therefore Juma
ideal and the better energy for you.

When I was looking for a pick-me-up
to get me through my studies, I really
have tried almost everything.

But my taste buds and my stomach
discarded most of them.
Fortunately, at the end!

That's how we came across the greatest tea
in world, imported it from Ecuador
and developed this natural energy drink.

Such that you can also
benefit from Guayusa.

dealDescription: Hi there! Thank you for your attention and feedback. We would like to say thank you by giving 25% on all products in our Webshop

description:
Welcome to our Story, we are Mohamed and Kim.

Our story begins with a journey, a journey that took us from different corners of the world and brought us together. Mohamed, born in Egypt, embarked on a new adventure when he moved to Germany a few years ago. That’s where he met Kim, who is originally from The Netherlands, and so it all began..

It was during our first trip to Egypt together that the seeds of our dream were planted. Experiencing the awe-inspiring beauty, rich heritage, and vibrant culture of Egypt left an indelible mark on our hearts.

And so, Roya was born. Roya is an Arabic word that translates to dream or vision. It is a dream coming true sharing the magic of Egypt with you.

One of the core values that defines Roya is our deep appreciation for craftsmanship and the artistry of Egyptian artisans. We are privileged to collaborate with talented individuals who possess the skill and passion to create the most beautiful handmade treasures. By showcasing their exceptional work, we aim to preserve traditional craftsmanship and support local communities.

We are grateful for the opportunity to embark on this journey and share our love for Egypt with you. Whether you are seeking a meaningful gift, a touch of elegance for your home, or simply a piece of art that resonates with your soul, we invite you to explore the treasures of Roya. Join us in celebrating the beauty, culture, and craftsmanship that Egypt has to offer.
name: Roya

pitchCaptions.text: Hi, I'm Kim.
And I'm Mo.

And we are the founders of Roya, the brand,
a company based in Bamberg, Germany.

We have an online store
where we sell handmade products
made by Egyptian artisans.

In this fast paced world, where everything
is being produced fast and cheap,

the appreciation for craftsmanship
that was thought from generation
to generation is being lost.

That's why in our shop, every product
is intentionally made with love and care,

using natural materials, making
every product a unique treasure.

One of our core values that defines Roya
is our deep appreciation for the products
that are handmade with love.

That's why we are very happy
to work with talented artisans in Egypt.

We want to assure that we work towards
a more beautiful and sustainable world.

So as a company, we embrace fair trade
values, making it a win win to everybody.

So we invite you to explore
the treasures of Roya.

And when our package arrives
on your doorstep, we hope you

experience the magic of Egypt
and the beauty of craftsmanship.

Cheers.
Cheers.

The story of Ruya started when we made
our first trip to Egypt together.

As I've been born in Egypt, I was so
excited to showcase my home country.
And I fell in love with Egypt.

The culture, the food, but especially all
the lovely people we met during our trip.

That's when the seeds
of our dream were planted.

dealDescription: We're excited to introduce you to Roya the Brand and give you an exclusive offer. To show our gratitude for your attention and feedback, we're happy to give you a 15% discount on your whole order.

description:
studio ORÁ focusses on sustainable, regional production of unique ceramic pieces. every piece is unique, every piece is produced in vienna, every piece protects the planet by working with 100% renewable energy.

And who is behind it?

Victoria is born in Vienna, she is a filmmaker and most recently took over the art direction of the award-winning film "corsage" by marie kreutzer. in 2023, she decides to realise a second dream and founds studio ORÁ, turning a passion into a business. traditional japanese techniques, casting processes, construction techniques and modelling work were used for the first collection.
name: ORÁ

pitchCaptions.text: Hi, I'm Victoria from Studio Ora

and I will now show you
my production facility.
I produce stoneware ceramics and

Earthenware and I do so
in Austria in the Vienna area.

The special thing about my pieces
is that each one is handmade;
from start to finish.
This means that there are no industrial

manufacturing techniques that are
used and everything is done by me.
Basically, everything from idea to

realisation to glazing to
firing takes place here.

And that's why it happens that
no two pieces are the same.
My production site is located

just outside Vienna in the halls
of a disused paper factory.

You can still see
dilapidated buildings here.

The rushing water is used to
generate electricity and energy,

so that I can work with
100% renewable energies.
All my pieces are made of high-fired

stoneware, which gives
them the same quality

such as the pottery we
find in ancient Pompeii.

This makes the quality one that,
if you want it to, lasts forever.

mainPhrase: Each piece is one of a kind
dealDescription: Hi there! Feel free to use this code for your first purchase at ORÁ and get a 10% discount on everything. In addition to that I will contact you after your purchase so you can choose your very own personalization of your product. Each of my products is unique by itself but you can make it your very own!
shortDescription: A Vienna based ceramics studio producing exclusive pieces.

description:
First developed over twenty years ago! Just chew the tablets and brush as usual. Or as we like to say, polish! Thanks to their 70% cellulose content, our tablets have a polishing effect that makes your teeth smoother. Combine them with our ultra-soft bamboo toothbrush to maximise this effect. Because we are water-free, we are free of potentially harmful ingredients.

We see our tablets as a symbol of change and challenging established routines.

In 1992, Axel Kaiser and his two brothers founded the dental laboratory proDentum in Berlin as a sales organisation for the parent laboratory in Singapore, which was initiated by his brother Christoph, to provide patients with high-quality and much more affordable dentures. At the end of the 1990s, Axel helped one of the dental customers with the practical part of his doctoral thesis. Topic: Development of an anhydrous toothpaste that would avoid many ingredients that were unnecessary for dental care but potentially critical for the body. After a few trials and a lot of research, a granulate was created. More out of curiosity than anything else, this was developed into a tablet, which was first sold in the autumn of 2003. Denttabs innovative Zahnpflegegesellschaft mbH, previously a proDentum project, was officially founded on 1 January 2009.

Denttabs only uses natural ingredients.

Did you know that toothpaste is still being sold which contains additives such as preservatives, germ inhibitors and stabilisers that are potentially problematic for the body and the environment?

Our toothpaste tablets consist exclusively of naturally certified ingredients that bear the Cosmos Natural seal of the BDHI.

They are anhydrous and can therefore do without unnecessary additives that are potentially critical for the body.

This not only protects the mucous membranes, but also keeps the waste water clean.

You can easily spit denttabs into the forest. You shouldn't do that with toothpaste!

Our tablets consist of 70% renewable cellulose. The cellulose fibres are obtained from woody plant parts and polish your teeth gently and ultra-smoothly right into the interdental spaces. As a result, new particles simply roll off the surface of your teeth. Plaque, also known as plaque, is practically prevented from forming in the first place.

Denttabs - a sustainable project.

Did you know that almost 500 million non-recyclable tubes of plastic are produced in Germany every year just from toothpaste and are simply incinerated?

Our Denttabs toothbrush tablets require approx. 80% less packaging than toothpaste and are packed in industrially compostable, bio-based bags. Less plastic and packaging with more content: one bag of toothbrush tablets is equivalent to two tubes of toothpaste.

The toothpaste tablets can also be used right up to the last tablet - up to 14% of toothpaste remains unused in the tube. Both the tablets and the packaging are lightweight and save considerably on weight and volume. This means less CO2 emissions during transport.

Of course, you can also find our toothpaste tablets in unpackaged shops: 100% zero waste.

We work for a future fit for grandchildren and are involved in numerous projects. Denttabs has been honoured with the German Sustainability Award 2021.

Denttabs- no foam needed

Did you know that you can brush your teeth perfectly without foam?

We are convinced that foam belongs on beer or in the bath, but not in the mouth. We have deliberately opted for a gentle, plant-based surfactant (Amisoft or Sodium Lauroyl Glutamate). It ensures that proteins, fats and carbohydrates combine with water and are flushed out when rinsing.

According to studies, Denttabs has exactly the same cleaning performance as conventional toothpaste, which mainly contains aggressive surfactants. Although aggressive surfactants foam, they have the disadvantage that they irritate the mucous membranes and can reduce the fluoride-containing remineralisation effect.
name: denttabs

pitchCaptions.text: Denttabs is a lot of things.
And it's definitely worth giving it a try.

It's simple, straightforward and
will bring about change in your life.

Strictly speaking, I
didn't found that at all.

The knowledge was there,
from a funny story.
And we wanted to give it away to the

Industry, i.e. those who are actually
responsible for dental care products.

But nobody wanted it, nobody wanted
to do it, nobody was interested in it.
So, stubborn as I am, I just do it myself.
Now with 20 years, it took a little
but slowly it's catching on.
The realisation is slowly sinking in.
And that's what we actually do.
We bring realisation of the better.
Also has a product behind it.
Go to dm.
Or visit us in the online shop.
The change.

To actually do the right thing from an
understanding of what is right.

We live in a big world of
transformation and through many

unfortunate circumstances, we are
now ready to actually change things.
Denttabs are part of this.
Get to know them, learn to understand them
and you will never go back to the old toothpaste.

First came the contraceptive pill,
then came Viagra, then came Denttabs.
We are also changing the world.

We are changing something that you
have felt was right all your life.
Now you'll learn the right way.

mainPhrase: For your teeth. For our environment.
dealDescription: Hey, it's great that you're interested in Denttabs! Of course, we understand that our product is completely new to you. To help you try our products, you can use the code ledge20 to save 20% off your entire order. To get the full Denttabs experience, we recommend combining the toothbrush with the tablets. Have fun with our products!
shortDescription: For your teeth. For our environment.

description: Far removed from the usual art clichés, the art:ig gallery stands primarily for naughty, young and snotty-nosed art beyond the yawning mainstream. Not only are modern paintings by up-and-coming artists sold here in limited and open editions, but they are also refined and individualized until the treated art print voluntarily falls out of the frame with joy. The basis for this is a diverse selection of paintings, photos and collages from the fields of pop art, black and white photography, street art, comics and skateboard surf design, which are printed on MDF boards using a special finishing technique, giving them an almost surgical facelift with a completely new face, but without any stitches behind the ears. Just as unique is the personalization and embellishment of pictures brought in by the customer, such as wedding photos, portraits or duckface selfies, which, in a 7-14 day processing time, go beyond the bounds of normality and boredom and, to the delight of the customer, leave the gallery as an artistic one-off for the living room wall. The fact that the maxim of the two competent gallery owners, Tommi Hallmann and Chryssi Tsiaoussi, is to embellish existing art so artistically that it becomes priceless unique pieces at affordable prices, is more than proven by the fact alone that this small but fine store has been able to survive for so long in the thicket of Munich's artificial gallery culture about Hundertwasser.
name: Galerie art:ig

pitchCaptions.text: Well, hi! What the heck is Art:ig?
I would say Art:ig is quite a lot.

Gallery, manufactory, art,
craftsmanship, inspiration, creativity.
What's more, over all these years

almost 20, we have also become
a sought-after event location.

I think we are unique because of
our specially developed technology.
This seems to be truly unique
because although we have seen something

similar, we have never
seen anything comparable.
At least not to this degree of perfection.
Because we create our pictures by hand
each picture is a unique piece.
Hm, good question.

I couldn't think of anything
better, except to become.
'art:ig'

no, I've always thought to myself,
there must be affordable art, not just

expensive originals or scrap from
furniture stores and the like.
How it's working?
Actually quite simple.
Drop by our shop and visit us directly
take something with you, browse via

Instagram or directly
in our online shop and

order, collect or have
delivered to your home.
Of course, you can also have your own

motif made if you don't find
anything in our collection,
which actually seems almost impossible.
Well, anyway, that works too.

Oh yes, and don't forget, you can
redeem the test not only online,

but of course also here
in the Art:ig Gallery.
See you!

dealDescription: Servus and thank you for your time and your feedback! As a small token of our appreciation, we would like to give you a 10% voucher that you can redeem on all our prints. Also feel free to drop by at our shop and get a free consultation. You can also use the code in an analog way ;)
shortDescription: Galerie art:ig primarily showcases naughty, young and snotty art

description:
Welcome to our world of vegan sauces!

Here tradition meets innovation, and flavor knows no bounds! I'm Maria, and I hail from the vibrant city of Munich, where beer gardens and majestic mountains are part of our everyday scenery. Inspired by the Bavarian way of life, we've crafted a range of sauces that embody the essence of joy and flavor, right here in the heart of Munich. At our core, we haven't reinvented the wheel; rather, we've taken the timeless allure of classic sauces and infused them with a vegan twist.

Our mission?

To make vegan food not just nutritious, but undeniably fun and flavorful for everyone. Whether you're a staunch vegan, a dedicated vegetarian, or a devout meat-eater, our sauces cater to all palates and preferences. From fruity-tomato to creamy or cheesy, each sauce is a celebration of taste and craftsmanship. We pour our love and expertise into every jar, ensuring that each spoonful delights the senses and leaves a lasting impression. And because we believe in sustainability, our jars are not only practical but also perfect for reuse. Whether you repurpose them as chic jam jars or utilize them for packaging loose goods, they're a testament to our commitment to reducing waste and embracing eco-conscious practices.

As a food technologist with a passion for quality, I've dedicated years to perfecting our production process and honing my skills in sales. It's this blend of expertise and enthusiasm that fuels our journey, allowing us to bring the best of vegan cuisine to tables far and wide. So, whether you're craving a taste of tradition or eager to embark on a culinary adventure, join us on this flavorful journey.

Because with our sauces, every meal is not just a dish – it's an experience, crafted with love and joy, right here in Munich. If you have any questions or simply want to chat about sauce, I'm here to help. Let's savor the flavor together!
name: The Vegan Saucery

pitchCaptions.text:
The Vegan Saucery is the
brand for vegan sauces.
We produce and pack in Munich,

because who wants sauces that have
flown halfway round the world?
We have not reinvented the wheel.

We have veganised only the tastiest
sauces to make them even tastier.

Because we want vegan
to be fun for everyone.
From the unusual cheesy style to

remoulade to ketchup,
we have everything for you.

I'm Maria, Head of Sauces
at The Vegan Saucery.

As a native of Munich and a
food technologist, I have the
overview on food production.
If our design gives you a

smile on your face, then we
have done everything right.
My favourite is
Mr. Pickle jar on the remoulade.

Have you heard of the
tomato in the paddling pool?

pitchSections.title: What the heck is the Vegan Saucery?
pitchSections.subtitle: Maria, Head of Sauces

mainPhrase: Made with plants from magic hands

Because our sauces don't just taste great for being vegan, they taste better than any non-vegan sauce as well.

description:
Sustainable

Our vision is a completely sustainable business practice. The maesh bags are made from 90% upcycled materials and are produced in Hanover in a resource-saving manner. Craftsmanship combined with a sense of aesthetics and design turn used advertising banners into a unique, functional and robust bag design. Each bag is unique.

Local 

The entire production of maesh bags is carried out at the Hanover-Nordstadt site. Product development, prototype production and final production - all this happens "UNDER ONE ROOF". One of our maesh missions is to give advertising banners throughout Germany a second chance and to design beautiful new bags from them. 

Social

Creating jobs for talented women with a history of migration or flight is our top priority. maesh is a product of this work philosophy and is not profit-oriented. All proceeds are used to maintain and expand the company and make a sustainable contribution to the common good and to strengthening Hanover as a production location.
name: maesh

pitchCaptions.text:
Hi, we are maesh, the sustainable,
local & social bag label from Hanover.

We make designer bags from
recycled advertising banners.

Our bags are unique, because every
processed advertising banner is different.

Whether plain, dotted or striped,
every bag is as individual as you are.
We produce our bags here in

Hanover in the under-one-roof
sewing workshop.

Everything is made in Germany
and with lots of love.
The banners come from the facades of

Festivals and when they actually
become rubbish, we turn them into bags.

First, they are brought to the
cutting table and cut to size,

then cleaned and sent to the
under-one-roof sewing workshop.
In the background you can see a

international team of women who lovingly
produce these fantastic unique pieces.

If you feel like it, then take
a look at our online store.

We empower women with immigration
background and create jobs
here in Hanover in the textile industry.

The fast fashion industry
shows this very clearly.
It's time to rethink.
We want to reshape the textile industry.

As you can see, maesh is
more than just a bag.

Together we are getting a little
bit closer to a better world.

dealDescription: Hey there! Thank you so much for your attention and feedback. We would like to give you a deal of 10% for your first purchase above 20€. Enjoy!

description:
We believe in purpose-driven regimes. co:aya means "come as you are". Our products are honest, made with highly effective, scientifically proven and often award-winning ingredients. Our simple 4 product skincare routine consists of a cleanser, your personal serum, your complementary cream and an effective SPF 50+ sunscreen. We have developed our PRAISE algorithm to select the best ingredients for you. Our products are gender neutral because your skin biology is what matters, not your heritage, skin colour or gender. Our products are vegan, fragrance free, made in Germany, cruelty free and climate optimised. co:aya empowers individuals to embrace their ever-evolving selves. Giving them the power to be who they are to the fullest and to enjoy the most essential part of beauty - their individuality.

They talk we science

Our products are honest, made with highly effective and scientifically tested active ingredients. We help you to know your skin as well as you know yourself. Our goal is to provide you with the most suitable skincare solution based on your goals, your skin and your lifestyle. This takes the guesswork out of skincare and eliminates the waste of wildly trying different products. Our packaging is also reusable and recyclable.
name: Co:aya

pitchCaptions.text: Co:aya is your personal skincare routine.

With all of our expertise, we
have built an algorithm that

finds the perfect active
ingredients for your skin biology.

Co:aya stands for Build
to be you, independent

of your origin, your skin
colour and your gender.

Our Co:aya routine is super
simple and yet effective.
It starts with the cleaning, which is mild

and powerful, then the serum with your
customised active ingredients that

cream balances your lipid and
moisture levels and our SPF

protects you from premature
skin ageing caused by UV rays.
Just go to co:aya.de

and click on Personalise
your product in the menu.

Then you can complete our skin quiz in a
few minutes and our algorithm will find

the right combination of
active ingredients for you.

We will then recommend
your serum and cream.

You can complement this
with the Cleanser and the

SPF and your Co:aya
skincare routine is ready.

Co:aya stands for Come As You Are
and our colon for gender neutrality.
We believe that around 70 per cent of

people do not get on well
with conventional cosmetics.
We are changing that.

We celebrate diversity and want to reach
as many people as possible with Co:aya by
giving a good feeling and beautiful skin.

dealDescription: Hi! Thank you so much for listening and your feedback. Our deal in return is the following: You will get a free Cleanser/SPF, if you buy our serum. However, for our deal to work you have to add the Cleanser and SPF to your basket and only once you fill in the code at the checkout, our shop will deduct the price of cleanser and SPF. If you have questions, contact us :)

description:
Hello! We are Limbo Essentials!

Limbo is a brand born from love and passion for healthy living, respect for the planet, and taking maximum care of our body and our environment.

“Mens sana in corpore sana” the balance between the spirit, mind and body in the best conditions and in the best balance.

This essence is what the two founders of this concept, Africa and Marina, share. Two engineers who, in the midst of our busy professional lives, had a vision.

Healthy living and sports need a healthy energy drink.

There are many energy drinks associated with enhancing energy, performance, strength or recovery for sports, but we envision a natural drink, capable of providing both these activating values, as well as relaxation properties, spiritual balance, rejuvenation and toning.

We find the ideal formula in the oldest drinks of traditional Japanese society. In the tea leaf, and specifically in macha tea, whose natural origin is green tea. The origin of tea is said to date back to 2737 BC when Emperor Shen Nong accidentally discovered it. Now, more than 4000 years later, our vision is fulfilled, with a perfect combination of a macha tea selected directly from a small town in Japan, enhancing its flavor and properties with excellent food supplements.

We are very proud to be able to offer you the result of our research, many hours of development, work and obsessive search for the best natural and healthy product. Our matcha tea with food supplements that we named Limbo Essentials.

We created Limbo Essentials with the purpose of spreading positive energy focused on well-being. We are passionate about challenging ourselves and exceeding our limits day after day, living the adventure with intensity, connecting with nature and enjoying the small moments with our friends to the fullest.

From the Limbo Essentials team, we want to take our passions to a higher level, and we would love for YOU to be part of it by accompanying us on this path.
name: Limbo Essentials

pitchCaptions.text:
Hello.
Hello.

This is Africa
and Marina!
We're the Co-Founders of Limbo Essentials.
So what the hell is limbo essentials?
This is a spanish brand from Barcelona.

Basically, it's matcha tea
with supplements to improve
your health and well being.

Our mission is to create
a big community where you can enjoy

doing sports and then enjoying just
drinking our matcha teas while you
are just taking care of yourself.

We wanted to explain you a little
bit more about our products.

So we currently have
three different products.

Limbo glow, limbo balance and limbo power.
Limbo glow

is our
beauty product.

It has collagen, vedic oil
that it's good for your skin,
for your nails, for your hair.

Limbo power, which is perfect if you
want to do some biking or just running.

We totally recommend you
to drink this kind of matcha
before doing this kind of sports.

And then finally we have
'The Balance' one, which is perfect

for your immunity and also
your stomach
and digestion.
Who is behind Limbo?
Africa and Marina.
We are two friends from Barcelona.

We are industrial engineers and we
wanted to do a big change in our lives.

So we decided to join our two worlds,
which is matcha teas and also the sport.

So we came across with a good idea
which is joining Matcha complements

and then doing a sport community.
So this is us!

description:
We are Boris and Oliver,

and together we started the development of the all in. WASH. Our goal: developing a personal care product that is as low packaging as a solid product, but at the same time offers the familiar convenience of a liquid product. For a sustainable bathroom, less carbon emissions and packaging waste - and yet without compromise.

We quickly realized that it was not enough to develop a water-free product, but that personal care products had to be completely rethought. After all, it is quite frightening what we put on our bodies, hair, hands and faces every day: aggressive surfactants, carcinogenic preservatives and microplastics are unfortunately still found in far too many products. We did not want that to be the case!

And, we have succeeded: 100% well thought-out and carefully selected ingredients and 0% marketing bla bla. Made in Germany, cruelty-free, vegan, biodegradable and without sulphates and other aggressive ingredients.

Let's change how we wash tomorrow together and not only make our world a little better every day, but drive the all-important change in the personal care industry - we can't wait!
name: soap&precede

pitchCaptions.text: With soap & precede.

We created an easy to use powder-to-liquid
solution which enables you to create your

own shower gel, shampoo and hand wash
at home in a simple few steps; all while

eliminating a lot of packaging and still
enjoying the comfort of a liquid product.

Soap & precede was created
by Oliver and me in 2020.

We wanted to find a way to reduce
plastic waste and carbon emissions

in our bathrooms, but still
keep using liquid products.
So we started inventing the all in. Wash.

Our all in. Wash has a unique
four in one formulation.

To achieve this, we boiled
down personal care products

to their absolute essence by using
only up to ten ingredients carefully
selected to take best care of you.
It's pretty simple.
You can take any bottle you like.

If you don't have one, you
can get a reusable dependence from us.

Add our powder and tap water
and give it a firm shake.

Let it sit for about ten minutes
and you're ready to go.

description:
Since 2008, we have ventured into remote rainforests to source the world’s rarest & fairest cacao beans and transform the cultures of chocolate, food and luxury. Today, we lead Europe's craft chocolate movement as a pioneer for regenerative business practices.

That may sound like a not-so-humble humblebrag. But we’re miles away from our larger goal of creating a food  culture that regenerates our world. In the meantime we promise that our chocolate will be the most delicious experience you’ll have fighting for the environment, its caretakers and inhabitants.

Our story of marrying chocolate and conservation may seem complicated but it’s actually quite simple. We make some of the world’s best chocolate from the rarest & fairest cacao beans around, and preserve these beans and their forest environments for future chocolate lovers. We’ve won all the major taste awards, are a favourite of top chefs, and have streamlined every aspect of our business to be people and planet positive.

On our own we grow a regenerative business. Together, let's regenerate what we consume. Together 100% regenerative.
name: Original Beans

pitchCaptions.text: Now, who is original beans?

The name original beans stands for
the rarest cacao beans in the world:
the original beans. Which for more than a decade now, we have found, sourced,

grown and ultimately produced into
one of the best chocolates of the planet.

The world's best chefs and chocolate
makers rave about our chocolates because
they tell the story of an origin.

They come from very far
away, rainforest places.

They are unique varietals
and we treat them in the agriculture,

in every step of the production
chain, as if they were jewels

and we make them into these delicious and
very soft melting chocolates

that speak of the origin. Together
with you regenerate what we consume

and we practise this in all respects
of our business and our products.

And for that reason, we've been awarded
and are reckoned as the most sustainable

chocolate company in the world
by the chocolate scorecard.

I founded original beans because
I wanted to create a company that gives
back more to the world than it takes.

This has literally been the mission
of my family for seven generations.

More than 200 years, my ancestors
have been protecting forests

and thinking about how
to regenerate the natural world

as we also produce food and
other products for us, consumers.

pitchSections.title: What the heck is Original Beans?
pitchSections.subtitle: Philipp, Founder

description:
Our mission

We are dedicated to empowering our customers and inspiring  sustainable fashion through our products and platforms. We are committed to creating a positive and mindful fashion industry. Our garments transform in harmony with your body, thanks to its adjustable sizing. Simultaneously, we exclusively utilize premium, timeless materials, ensuring our pieces endure the test of time and possess the capability to be cherished by generations to come. High-quality and timeless fabrics, such as silk, cotton, and wool, are key for creating garments that will last and will be able to transition through the years. Natural materials have long been cherished in the fashion world for their inherent beauty, comfort, and sustainability. Finally, making sure that the garment has a comfortable fit that is easy to move in and flattering is important to ensure that customers have the most positive experience wearing MIA & SOLE.

We, the Founders

MIA & SOLE was founded in 2023 by Sophia Brandis and Marlene Engel and is based in Berlin. “We must focus on eliminating rushed production processes and commit to using only high-quality materials, labor practices, and product standards. We want to focus on understanding the customer's needs and expectations. Ultimately, we want to create garments that are made to last.”

How it works

The fit of the clothes should depend on the individual wearing them. Every person has a different body shape and size, and may need clothes to be tailored to fit them perfectly. The pull strings and special tying techniques are designed to let you quickly and easily adjust the fit of the clothing so that it is comfortable regardless of whether you are wearing a size small, medium, or large. Simply pull or release the strings in the designated areas for a more customized fit.

Sustainability

For our products we are exclusively using natural fabrics, mostly produced in Italy. All of the materials are sourced from Europe. Each piece of clothing is meticulously crafted in Europe. Our chosen manufacturing partners are situated in Poland, Portugal and Lithuania. Only a limited number of pieces are produced to set an example against the overproduction in the fashion industry. Sustainability Materials that we use: Tencel, Organic Cotton, Cotton, Merino Fine Wool, Wool, Cashmere, Silk, Viscose, Cupro The knitting yarns are following the 4 sustainability framework: 4sustainability® is an innovative implementation framework and a registered trademark assuring the sustainability performances of fashion & luxury supply chain. The hangtags are made of uncoated paper, 80% recycled material and 20% pure E.C.F fiber. Both are FSC certified. The product is completely biodegradable and recyclable. The care labels are made of 100% organic cotton and carry the Öko-Tex Standard 100 certificate. The main label and size label are from 100% cotton.
name: Mia & Sole

pitchCaptions.text:
Mia and Sole is a fashion brand offering
adaptable garments with a focus on
comfort and high quality craftsmanship.

Our pieces are designed to
be versatile and to change with you.

We care about the environment, therefore,
we only use natural and high quality
fabrics exclusively from Europe.

Our goal is to provide a collection
that stay in your wardrobe
and stand the test of time.

We make garments that transform
in harmony with your body thanks
to its adjustable sizing system.

To make them adaptable, you can find
unique design elements on each piece
giving them a clear purpose and function.

Also, we only use natural and high quality
materials, ensuring the product to be

long lasting and possess the capability
to be cherished by generations to come.

The fit of the clothes should depend on
the individual wearing them.
By special tying techniques or simply.
by pulling or releasing

fabric strings in shoulders,
sleeves or side seams,

you adapt the piece of clothes
to your body and not only get the maximum
comfort, but also nice design details.

We want to make comfortable yet elegant
pieces that fit through the changes that
your body and mind is making.

So we invented special tying techniques
to change with you and have the chance to
stay forever in your wardrobe.

Also, we are committed
to create a positive, inspiring
and mindful fashion industry.

pitchSections.title: What the heck is Mia & Sole?
pitchSections.subtitle: Marlene, Co-Founder

dealDescription: Hey there! Thank you for your interest in our brand. We would love for you to try our products and give us feedback on what you think about adjustable garments. That is why we would like to give you 15% on all products for your first purchase. Just use our code, when checking out on our website.
shortDescription: Adaptable clothing with a focus on comfort and quality. Made with care for the environment

description:
I am Pedro Monge,

Monge Shoes’s alma mater.

I studied Journalism in Madrid and, since I was young, the world of leather has been my passion, especially shoes and accessories. I started working in fashion magazines and, later, I learned about shoes in companies like Camper.

Craftsmanship

Historically in Mallorca, the Mediterranean island where I live, the footwear industry has been fundamental to the economy and is still recognized today for its quality. Nowadays there are few workshops left, but they maintain the artisan spirit and quality standards with which we materialize the designs that we and our friends like to wear.
name: Monge

pitchCaptions.text: Hi!

Monge is a brand of shoes made in
Mallorca, where the shoemaking tradition
has existed since middle ages.

In the fifties, there were more than 60
factories making shoes here.

But now there are just a few
workshops left and we keep betting

on the shoe making know-how
that still resides in this island.

Our mission is to continue the Majorcan
footwear tradition and make

shoes and accessories that both,
we and our friends would love to wear.
And who's behind it?
Well, behind Monge is me, Pedro Monge.

I'm a shoe enthusiast that
has worked in fashion journalism and

well-known shoe companies before
embarking my own adventure in 2012.

What makes our product unique
is that the quality of Majorcan shoes is
recognised among the best in the world.

The craftsmen have been perfecting
their techniques generation

after generation, and the result
is a shoe that is almost a work of art.

dealDescription: Hola! Feel free to use a 20% discount on any shoes you like. I am confident that your first purchase of Monge Shoes won't be your last.
shortDescription: Handmade shoes & espadrilles from Mallorca, Spain.

description:
Crafting Conscious Steps with Wayz

At Wayz, we believe in sneakers with a story – a story of ethical craftsmanship, timeless design, and sustainable living.

Locally Sourced, Globally Loved

From Porto, Portugal, to your feet, our sneakers are made with love and care. Every pair is crafted with eco-friendly materials sourced within a 70-kilometer radius, reducing our carbon footprint and supporting local artisans.

Quality without Compromise

Fair prices, impeccable quality – that's our promise. By working closely with ethical partners and minimizing intermediaries, we offer sneakers that stand the test of time without breaking the bank.

Built to Last, Designed for Life

Solid construction, durable materials – our sneakers are made to accompany you on life's adventures. With proper care, they become more than shoes; they become cherished companions.

Care for Your Wayz

Keep them clean, repair when needed, recycle when it's time to part ways – sustainability isn't just a buzzword for us; it's a way of life.

People First, Planet Always

We're more than a shoe brand; we're a community committed to making a positive impact. From valuing diversity to protecting our planet, every step we take is a step towards a better world.

Join the Movement

Step into conscious living with Wayz – because every step matters.
name: Wayz

pitchCaptions.text:
Wayz is an ethical sneaker brand
whose purpose is to inspire people

to find their ways to a
more authentic and zestful life.

We call it sneakers with a humanistic
footprint because they are inspired by
people's authenticity and diversity.

Each model was designed to represent
a personality trait we admire: the misfit,

the sonder, the hedonist,
and the wanderer.

Our mission is to create timeless, lasting
and eco-friendly sneakers, transparently
and locally made at fair prices.

We aim to change the way sneakers are made
and consumed, inspiring conscious choices.
Behind Wayz it's me, Pedro.

After a long career in retail,
I decided to launch a sneaker brand
and I'm the business mind behind Wayz.

Danielle, my Co-Founder,
is our designer and of course we
share a common passion for sneakers.

Together and with Wayz, we
want to bring humanity to the heart

of businesses, empowering people
and protecting our planet.

Wayz are a unique product
because they have a great design.

They are locally sourced and produced
in Porto with high quality and

eco-friendly materials like vegetable
tanned leather and recycled rubber.

These materials make Wayz shoes
very comfortable and long lasting.

We can even repair them or resell,
extending its life and hopefully

guaranteeing that they will
become part of your life and memories.

dealDescription: Olá! You get a 25€ discount on all non discounted / full price shoes of ours.Walk your way!

Honestly just the best sneakers I’ve bought
I’ll never wear other sneakers again

description:
Having worked in different Cafés and Bars throughout our studies, the founding team (Pete, Emanuel and Lucas) have always worked within the gastronomy business. Due to our diverse academic backgrounds in Architecture, Mathematics and Politics, it seemed as an obvious next step to collaborate and choose a secure job path, which meant opening a café in the midst of a pandemic.

Through our Specialty Coffee tour throughout Europe, and having worked at local specialty coffee shops in Munich, it became apparent to us that we would want to take part in the transformation of the Italian influenced coffee scene in Munich.

The initial idea consisted of sourcing 100% arabica beans, either directly or from trustworthy partners, in order to share the third wave experience with you. „Third Wave“ is the new coffee revolution, which not only aims at re-thinking coffee as a luxury product, but to extract and experience coffee with all its flavors, which none of the supermarket and capsule coffee products could achieve.

Have you ever wondered about our name and how we came up with Suuapinga? One of the oldest neighborhoods in Munich is Schwabing. Initially mentioned in the year 782 as Suuapinga, it’s actually older than the city Munich itself.
name: Suuapinga

pitchCaptions.text:
Hi, my name is Lucas, and I'm one
of the three founders of Suuapinga.

You're probably thinking,
what the heck is Suuapinga?

Well, we decided to open
a specialty coffee cafe and started
our own coffee brand back in 2021.

And the first location
is in Munich, Schwabing.

And Schwabing's old name,
old german name is Suuapinga.
That's the brand name.

Well, we produce specialty
coffee, and specialty coffee is known

for its quality, traceability,
and its unique flavors in the beans.

We emphasize sustainability
throughout our supply chain.

We do this by only sourcing small lot,
single origin beans through direct trade
with the farmers in their countries.

We're three friends,
Pete, Emi, and myself, Lucas.

We've known each other since
working in bars, cafes, and restaurants
throughout our times at university.

Once we were finished with our degrees,
we decided to go ahead with the project

because there would be
no better time to do so.
Well, there's basically two methods.

Either you swing by one of our locations
and taste our self made pastries and

our coffee beans, or you order our beans
through our webshop and try them at home.

Either way, we would love for
you to give us feedback on how you like
the coffee, and we hope to see you soon.

description:
At oeá, we're a mother-daughter team driven by a shared passion for creating unique, handmade products. Our mission is simple: to inspire you to step away from the hustle of everyday life, take a moment for yourself, and reconnect with what truly matters. We believe that even the smallest moments of calm can make a big difference, and our products are designed to help you find that peace.

Meet Andrea

Andrea is the heart of oeá. Living in a charming house by the lake in the beautiful region of Mecklenburg, she handcrafts and tests our candles and soaps with great care. Her dedication ensures that every product you hold is the best it can be, made with love and attention to detail.

Meet Johanna

Johanna, Andrea’s daughter, manages everything else at oeá. From product development and marketing to customer relationships, she’s the visionary behind the brand. Her passion drives us forward, ensuring that our products not only reflect our values but also reach those who seek a more relaxed, stress-free life.

How It All Began

The foundation of oeá was laid over 10 years ago when we began making soap for ourselves. Our journey truly took off just two years ago when we established our soap kitchen in the middle of nature, surrounded by the beauty that inspires us every day. We have always believed that nature plays a vital role in our well-being, and that reducing daily stress and using healthy, natural products are essential for a balanced life.

Our Mission

Our goal is simple: to help you destress and bring more peace into your daily routine. We want to make it easier for you to slow down, relax, and enjoy moments of calm – even if that means giving yourself permission to be lazy sometimes. With our handmade candles, soaps, and more, we hope to make your home a sanctuary of serenity.

Thank you for being part of the oeá journey, and we wish you much joy in discovering your new favorite products!

Your oeá team.
name: oeá

description:
RAIIZ, inspired by the Spanish word "raíz," meaning "root," symbolizes where we come from and where we find our sense of belonging. It’s about feeling at home, no matter where we are.

My Story

I’m Paula García de Salazar, an architect and designer originally from Spain. Since 2012, Munich has been my second home, where I live with my small family and pursue my passion for design. My journey began with studying architecture in Madrid and Milan, but my love for working with my hands led me to discover woodworking. I became fascinated by creating functional art – objects that not only serve a purpose but also reflect beauty and my personal touch. I love helping others achieve the same in their own spaces.

For me, design is a playful, creative process. I combine materials, textures, colors, and forms until everything harmonizes and interacts with the surrounding space. Out of my roots, architectural background, and passion for art, RAIIZ was born. Every piece I create, whether a lamp or a mirror, is a reflection of my journey – and of yours.

What We Do

At RAIIZ, we design and handcraft unique, customizable lamps and mirrors. Each object is not just functional and beautiful but also a true reflection of individuality and personality.

Let RAIIZ bring a touch of artistry and warmth to your home.
name: RAIIZ

pitchCaptions.text:
Hi, my name is Paula
and Raiiz is my design studio.
I do what I call functional art.

I have a collection of lamps and mirrors
that are completely designed and handmade
by me in my workshop in Munich.

What makes my pieces unique is that they
are entirely handmade and custom made.

They can be customized
in size, color and materials.

So I like the idea to help people
to identify with their spaces to
participate also in the design process.
Behind Raiiz is just me, Paula.

I'm a spanish architect who moved
to Munich twelve years ago and everything

started when I moved in with my husband
and we were looking for a lamp for our

living room but we couldn't really find
something that we liked or that convinced

us so we decided to design
it and make it ourselves.

You are welcome to visit my website
where you can find the entire collection

with the different models
of mirrors and lamps.

But if you are unsure you have
any questions you can always contact me
and I will be really happy to help.

description:
portance is tech-driven sports fashion for a better future. We’re committed to creating innovative sportswear that reduces environmental impact. By combining advanced anti-odor textile technologies with eco-friendly materials, and producing everything in Europe, we significantly lower the carbon footprint of each garment.

Our Promise

We get it—life is busy. portance sportswear is designed to help you transition seamlessly from work to workout, eliminating distractions so you can focus on what matters. Each piece is thoughtfully crafted with sustainable biotechnology and innovative tech to simplify your routine, before, during, and after training.

Dominic's Story

portance was born from my personal experience. As a shy teen who struggled with his body image, fitness helped transform my life, but balancing it with a busy schedule became harder over time. That’s when I envisioned a sportswear brand that makes staying active easier, with no compromises. In 2019, I took the leap and founded portance to help others experience the same positive change.

Sustainability First

Our designs use organic cotton from Turkey and India, and recycled polyester made from old PET bottles. Thanks to advanced FUZE™ technology, our garments stay fresh longer, reducing the need for frequent washing. Even the smallest details—labels, zippers, and packaging—are made from recycled materials.

Made in Europe

Every portance product is hand-stitched in a family-run factory in Poland, ensuring ethical production and fair wages. We’re proud of our transparent supply chain and close relationships with all our partners, creating sportswear that’s smarter, cleaner, and more sustainable for the future.
shortDescription: Wear the sports fashion of the future
name: portance

description:
At Blue Farm, we believe in creating plant-based products that are good for you and the planet. On average, our customers purchase the equivalent of 10 liters of oat drink in powder form, saving 10 beverage cartons with each purchase. Our powder weighs 9 times less than packaged oat drinks, significantly reducing transport emissions by replacing truck deliveries with water straight from your tap.

Sustainable Packaging

Yes, our packaging is plastic. After extensive research, we found that monoplastic is currently the most sustainable option in Europe, as it can be 100% recycled. While compostable packaging may seem eco-friendly, it isn’t yet processed in urban waste facilities and often ends up incinerated.

Reducing CO2

Even though our oat drink powder requires drying, it still achieves a significantly lower carbon footprint—up to 1/3 less than packaged oat drinks and more than 2/3 less than cow’s milk.

Founded in Berlin in 2020 by Phil and Katia, Blue Farm is part of a movement that thinks ahead. We’re rethinking plant-based milk to make it not just an alternative, but an optimized, sustainable, and nutritious choice. Our mission? Power to the plant! With a team of 10, we aim to inspire a healthier, more sustainable lifestyle, while offering a creamy, delicious experience with natural ingredients. Everyone is welcome at the farm!
name: Blue Farm

pitchSections.title: What the heck is Blue Farm?

description:
Founded in 2023 by designer Viviane Gehring, VI[NTA]GE is a young fashion label that gives pre-loved, secondhand clothing a second life through creative redesign. Each piece we create is a unique work of art, blending sustainability with style. We believe every garment has a story, and it deserves to be continued. For us, sustainability isn’t just a trend – it’s the foundation of everything we do. Every item that leaves our atelier is handcrafted with love, using resource-efficient and fair production methods.

Our Mission

More than 80% of clothing in the EU is thrown away. In consumer-driven societies, most used garments end up in landfills or incinerators, contributing to millions of tons of textile waste globally. At VI[NTA]GE, we aim to combat this issue by focusing on longevity and mindful consumption. Our mission is to move away from fast fashion and instead create timeless, stylish clothing that minimizes harm to our planet. We’re committed to making the fashion world more sustainable and individual—one unique piece at a time.

We’d love for you to join us on this journey. We love Preloved!
name: VI[NTA]GE

pitchCaptions.text:
Have you ever thought about what
happened with all your clothes?
that you no longer wear?

Millions of tonnes of textiles
are produced every year, of which

a considerable proportion ends up
as waste at rubbish depots.

With Vintage, we want to help reduce
these mountains of clothing waste

and, away from short-lived trends,
focus on longevity and
conscious consumption of clothing.

With Vintage, we want to change
the way fashion is produced.
and consumed.

Through the reuse and
redesign of previously worn

clothing, all vintage items have a
positive impact on our environment

and are also unique pieces that
cannot be bought a second time.

In addition to the sustainable
production of our garments,
we particularly value good quality.
Of course, this has its price.

Our customers don't just buy
clothes, they support a vision.

Each of our garments is handcrafted
with the greatest care and attention to

detail in our studio in
Germany, in order to not only fulfil

the requirements for sustainability,
but also to fulfil the demands of
durability and wearing comfort.

pitchSections.title: Why do you pay a Premium?

description:
Founded in 2021, Seijo is an independent design studio focused on creating aesthetic and functional objects that go beyond the ordinary. We don’t follow trends or conventions. Instead, we trust our instincts and work on what we believe is truly valuable and necessary. Seijo objects blend traditional craftsmanship with modern techniques, using high-quality materials to create long-lasting designs. We are committed to responsible production, working closely with local artisans and responsible manufacturers across Germany and Europe.

Our Materials

We carefully select materials that bring both beauty and function. For example, our shadow gap frames are handcrafted from MDF (Medium-Density Fiberboard)—a strong and smooth engineered wood that allows for precise crafting and a clean finish. Treated with natural wood oil, these frames not only look refined but are built to last. Another key material is layered cork, chosen for both its aesthetic appeal and functional benefits.

Additionally, our Seijo muslin towels are made from 100% certified organic cotton, crafted in Germany using GOTS-certified, triple-layered fabric. These towels are absorbent, quick-drying, and bring a touch of simple elegance to your spa routine.

Why Seijo?

The name "Seijo" (正常) comes from the Japanese word for "normal." But Seijo objects are anything but ordinary. They challenge everyday norms by adding aesthetic value and functionality, fitting seamlessly into any space. We believe that even the simplest items deserve to be reimagined and brought to life with quality materials and thoughtful design. Seijo is more than just normal—it's a new standard of beauty and purpose.
shortDescription: Aesthetic everyday objects, manufactured in Germany
name: seijo

pitchCaptions.text:
Hi, I'm David Meyer,
the founder of Seijo Object.

As a designer, I focus on product,
furniture and interior design.

Hi, I'm Johanna Eichnermeyer, co-founder
and the art director of our brand.

We combine our desire for natural
materials and reduced esthetics
and understandable objects.

Seijo is a brand for home accessories
designed by ourselves in Germany
and produced in Europe.
We are based in Eichstedt, near Munich.

We produce directly in our workshop, work
with regional craft businesses
and family companies across Europe.

Seijo is an independent think tank
for the design and esthetic
and functional objects.

We are not committed
to any trend or direction.

We work creatively, responsibly,
on the things that we consider to
be truly valuable and necessary.

Everyday objects are the focus,
but seijo objects are
something more than just normal.

They deviate esthetically from the norm
and can be used in all rooms
of the house and in various contexts.

description:
At As Easy as That, we’re all about ending overuse and waste. Our eco-friendly products for washing, cleaning, and skincare support your sustainable, climate-conscious lifestyle. Made in Germany, our products are straightforward, effective, and designed with the planet in mind.

What We Offer

In our shop, you’ll find everything from concentrated laundry detergents and mini dishwasher tabs to upcycled skincare. All our products are designed to save resources and reduce their carbon footprint. We focus on essentials—no unnecessary ingredients—ensuring everything works efficiently while being kind to the environment.

Our Commitment

Founded by an experienced engineer in cosmetics and detergents, As Easy as That is the result of over 15 years in the industry and a passion for minimal, eco-friendly solutions. During the 2020 lockdown, our founder took the opportunity to turn her dream of a sustainable product line into reality, inspired by the simple yet effective methods of her grandmother.

We are passionate about climate neutrality. Every product we create is carbon neutral, vegan, and cruelty-free. We prioritize transparency with a clear ingredient list and provide tracking URLs so you can see the CO₂ offset for each item. Our Clean Beauty philosophy means no microplastics or artificial fragrances, and even our packaging is eco-friendly.

We love upcycling! Many of our skincare products use ingredients that would otherwise go to waste, helping reduce production waste and CO₂ emissions.

Sustainable living made easy—that’s what we’re all about!
shortDescription: Ecological and sustainable cosmetics and detergents
name: as Easy as That

pitchCaptions.text: As easy as that
stands for how easily you can

bring sustainability
into your everyday life.
We do this with the help of sustainable

cosmetics, detergents
and washing-up liquid,

cleaning liquid;
and all that in a special way.

I founded As Easy As That because at
some point I simply had enough.

I have been working
for many, many years in

the cosmetics, detergents
and cleaning industry.
And because every day in my work I

saw what can actually be done
better, I at some point

decided: If you don't do it,
then I'll just do it myself.

Products, and this is
very important to me, are

all manufactured in Germany, even
very close to our office location.
Apart from that, I naturally use

only selected and sustainable ingredients
and unfortunately they always have

still a significantly higher
price than the standard.
But if you buy one of these bags,

you have so much yield with it and you
can rinse with it for months,

that is totally different
than the current standard.

And: it does something good
for the environment
and that is the idea behind it.
My products are so unique,

because I really only
put in what is necessary.

They are therefore highly
concentrated and highly effective.

Like our small mini
dishwashers tabs, for example.
You can also use them at home in

save more than 60% of chemicals in your
everyday life just by doing the dishes.

pitchSections.title: What the heck is as Easy as That?
Why do you pay a premium?

description:
Founded in 2017 by Justine, who transitioned from architecture in France to leather craftsmanship in Italy, ANJU began as l'Atelier on Türkenstraße. In 2022, after Anna joined the team following an inspiring internship, the studio evolved into ANJU – Studio for handmade leather goods.

Our Mission

At ANJU, we blend our generational perspectives to create timeless designs rooted in minimalism, simplicity, and enduring craftsmanship. Every piece is handmade from premium leather in our Munich atelier, prioritizing sustainability and uniqueness. We offer an alternative to fast fashion by focusing on quality, local craftsmanship, and designs that never go out of style. ANJU represents sustainability, timeless design, and exceptional craftsmanship.
name: an.ju studio

pitchCaptions.text:
Hey, we are Anju, a design studio
based in Munich that specialises in the

in the design and production
of leather goods.

For seven years, we have been developing
bags and accessories as well as

customised leather products
for fashion and your home.

We combine craftsmanship and
design to create a unique mix that we

offer for both, private customers
and commercial projects.

We are very keen to apply the
principles of the circular economy
and to produce in a sustainable manner.

All our products are made by hand in
Munich and we design

our products so that they
are timeless and durable.

Two years ago, we launched our
'forget me not' project, in which

we give secondhand crocodile bags
with innovative designs and fresh details
a new life.

In this way, we want to encourage our
customers to change their
consumer behaviour and

offer them a sustainable alternative
to the fast fashion industry.

Sustainability is very important to us
in the production of all our products.

We combine quality with craftsmanship
and thus want to set ourselves
apart from other fashion brands.

That's why we take great care to use
environmentally friendly materials
and to be part of the local economy.

description:
Founded in 2017 by Justine, who transitioned from architecture in France to leather craftsmanship in Italy, ANJU began as l'Atelier on Türkenstraße. In 2022, after Anna joined the team following an inspiring internship, the studio evolved into ANJU – Studio for handmade leather goods.

Our Mission

At VAELU, we create clothing that is fair, durable, and as environmentally friendly as possible. Our mission is to craft truly aesthetic garments that hold value through high-quality natural materials, skilled craftsmanship, and the honest stories behind each piece.

Sustainability at Our Core

Respect for resources is at the heart of everything we do. Each VAELU garment is handcrafted in Germany, with many pieces made on demand to offer customization options and ensure a perfect fit for every body type. By tailoring our clothing to order, we reduce waste and offer a more personalized experience.

From Field to Client

We consider the complete journey of each garment – from the sourcing of raw materials to its final use. Our timeless, minimalistic designs focus on neutral colors and clean silhouettes, creating a versatile wardrobe that can be mixed and matched effortlessly. Every detail, from the finest natural fabrics to sustainable elastic, reflects our commitment to quality and sustainability.

VAELU represents more than just clothing – it’s a conscious choice for timeless fashion, crafted with care.
shortDescription: Ethical, minimalistic fashion handcrafted in Germany
name: VAELU

pitchCaptions.text:
Hey, I'm Dania and I'm the founder of
VALUE, an ethical fashion label with the

vision to redefine the
value of our clothing.

From the fibre to the finished garment
and from the fabric to the smallest

button, VALUE looks at the entire value
chain from the smallest button and designs

every step of this value chain as
ecologically and sustainably as possible.

During my professional experience
as a designer, I have

repeatedly realised that many steps in the
chain are not transparent at all.

At the same time, it is very
difficult for consumers

to understand what can make
a garment more sustainable.

My aim is to stimulate real
change beyond the purchase

and to ensure that people have
a bond with their clothes again.

The mission behind Value is building
a company that already does

something good when
producing the clothes.

We also have many projects
at an ecological level,

such as recycling local sheep's wool and
thus want to promote sustainability
to a new level. I am excited

for everyone who is
accompanying us on this journey.

mainPhrase: Let's redefine the vaelu of our clothes

description:
Rugtales is a family-run business rooted in six generations of Persian rug expertise, dating back to our origins in Hamburg’s historic Speicherstadt. For us, Persian rugs have always been more than just decor—they are pieces of art, tradition, and storytelling. Growing up surrounded by the beauty and history of these rugs, we eventually embraced our family heritage to bring these unique pieces to a modern audience.

Our online shop offers handpicked, handcrafted rugs and Kelim sourced directly from Iran. Each rug is a one-of-a-kind creation, made from natural materials like wool and cotton, and reflects centuries-old craftsmanship. Whether you're looking for colorful Kelim from the Gashgai nomads or finely woven pieces from Nain and Isfahan, we ensure quality, authenticity, and fair pricing.

At Rugtales, we believe these rugs deserve recognition from a new generation. Our mission is to reintroduce the charm and craftsmanship of Persian rugs, moving beyond the “grandmother’s rug” stereotype. We hope to take you on a magical journey through the world of Persian rugs, where tradition meets modern design.

Join us on this journey and discover the timeless beauty of handmade rugs!
name: Rugtales

pitchCaptions.text: Hi and 'Moin' from Hamburg.

Rugtails is selling handmade and unique
rug and kilim dreams, and the brand was
founded by my brother Amin and myself.

And we are now in the 6th generation
in our family, selling handmade rugs

and are trying to bring alive,
actually, the beautiful tales
that are behind those masterpieces.

Our mission, obviously, is to bring beauty
and uniqueness to the world and to your

apartments, but also to bring alive the
astonishing tales they need to be told.

This is actually why we founded rugtails,
because we felt like those weavers,
they need to be seen.

It's them who are making, hand
making those masterpieces,
those art pieces, if you will.
Our product is actually unique by nature,
because 95% of our assortment are actually

handmade and unique kilim and rugs,
which are mostly made by nomadic women

who live in tents still,
or in their little houses
in villages around bigger cities.

And all of our rugs are made
from sustainable materials,

like organic wool or cotton.
Yeah.
And that is actually the beauty of it.

mainPhrase: One of a kind for one of a kind.

description: uyo organics was born from a desire to reduce plastic consumption at home. Our organic hair care products are designed to look great in your bathroom while eliminating unnecessary packaging waste. They work because of their high-quality natural ingredients, not through chemicals or marketing tricks. Our hair care is good for you and the greater good, all without compromising on comfort or effectiveness. Our goal is to seamlessly integrate sustainable, natural cosmetics into everyday life and make them the standard.
shortDescription: UYO is your new sustainable organic hair care
name: UYO organics

pitchCaptions.text:
Yes, hello, my name is Zacharias, I
am the founder of uyo Organics and we

have developed a haircare product
that works great on the one hand,

which is designed on the basis
of purely natural ingredients.

It is based on field-fresh Ayurvedic
plants and herbs and

on the other hand, is as
sustainable as possible.

We came up with it because we are
fans of liquid shampoo ourselves.

We find them simply unbeatably
practical and when we started to think

about it, there were simply hardly any
sustainable offerings for liquid
shampoos that also work well.

And we thought to ourselves
that it must be possible
to develop anything.
It turned out that it wasn't that easy.

We experimented for a total of two
years until we found the shampoos

that we now offer and we are
really pleased with the products,
that have developed from this.

And we have developed the first liquid
shampoo concentrate with which you can
mix your own shampoo at home.

To do this, pour the concentrate into our
design dispenser, fill it up with water

and then you have 250 ML that will
last you five, six weeks or longer.

And this means that the
packaging can be plastic-free.

And although it is made of easily
recyclable glass, it has a lower

weight and takes up less space
during transport than a comparable
Shampoo in a plastic bottle.

Yes, our mission is to provide
beauty and care products that are good

for us, that have the least possible
impact on the environment and are
as sustainable as possible.

are packaged and work
perfectly at the same time.

pitchSections.title: What the heck is UYO organics?

mainPhrase: UYO is your new sustainable organic hair care

description:
My atelier bears my name – every piece reflects my personal touch and is handcrafted by me in Bavaria. I create unique jewelry and objects from wire, offering both one-of-a-kind pieces and limited series.

One line, VIIVAKORU, features wire that is welded and powder-coated, including rings, pendants, and earrings. In the realm of home and office decor, these objects can be customized in any RAL color.

Additionally, I create hand-knitted jewelry using traditional techniques, with wires made from gold, silver, titanium, steel, and copper in various colors, often paired with unique closures crafted from precious woods. I also love to accommodate custom requests regarding materials, designs, and sizes to create a truly personalized piece of jewelry.
shortDescription: Jewelry and objects made from wire
name: Atelier Theresa

pitchCaptions.text:
Theresa is a creative company
in Bavaria with a focus on
jewellery and objects made of wire.

On the one hand, jewellery is hand-knitted
using the old technique with a
spool knitter and on the other hand

jewellery and
objects are made from welded,
powder-coated wire.

I combine new and old techniques
and I also fulfil individual
wishes of my customers

for a very personal piece. The whole thing
applies not only in the
jewelry sector, but

I also offer unique solutions
for art objects.
Who is behind the brand?
That's me, Theresa Zellhuber.

I am an enthusiastic jewellery artist and
since 1996 I have been
making unique pieces and

small series and each
piece bears my signature.
What is my mission?

My mission is to keep the customer
coming back with enthusiasm.

pitchSections.title: What the heck is Atelier Theresa?
